Professional Summary
Passionate student at Cal Poly Pomona leading initiatives in collegiate Esports. Skilled in project and community & event management, graphic design, and copywriting with experience in organizing large-scale Esports/gaming events. Eager to learn and support marketing/event operations in the gaming industry.

EXPERIENCE

Marketing Team Lead, Bronco Esports
[September 2024 ‚Äì Present]

Directed themes and coordinated media production for large-scale in-person Esports events‚ÄìFragFest‚Äìthat results in 400+ attendees.

Worked cross-functionally with Esports organizations like Gen.¬†G and the marketing team, to develop creative promotional content from social events, generating tangible media that effectively boosted community engagement.

Wrote engaging creative and informative copy for Discord announcements, Instagram, and Twitter, effectively promoting events and tournaments.

Conceptualized and executed League of Legends-related social events such as in-houses, watch parties, and competitive tournaments, fostering community engagement in online and in-person settings.

Designed 20+ promotional graphics advertising club events that reinforced and enhanced the Bronco Esports brand identity.

Assessed engagement from all Bronco Esports social media platforms to refine marketing strategies and event planning.





League of Legends Community Manager, Bronco Esports
[February 2023 ‚Äì Present]

Led initiatives to grow the Bronco Esports League of Legends community with monthly social events/campaigns for over 150+ members.

Optimized the Bronco Esports LoL Hub Discord server by restructuring roles and redesigning sections with an aesthetically pleasing design, improving navigation for new and existing users.

Directed marketing strategies that enhanced community engagement with exclusive Discord server roles and prizes for social event/campaign participants.

Consistently communicated efficiently with club members, participants, and attendees in-person and online helping events/campaigns run smoothly.

Frequently monitored and reported on competitor Esports club activities and Discord server operations identifying opportunities to improve engagement and event quality.




League of Legends Team Manager, Bronco Esports
[May 2024 ‚Äì Present]

Collaborated with college Esports club leaders to organize scrims for player and team evaluations.

Managed team schedules and meetings, creating informative presentations for monthly updates and tournament preparation reinforcing club objectives.

title: Marketing Analytics In Gaming and Esports
text: Below are selected projects for the data-driven work I‚Äôve done related to gaming and Esports. I‚Äôve combined my passion for competitive gaming and social media with marketing analytics to uncover insights, optimize strategies, and drive engagement for the communities I work with. Whether analyzing social media trends for esports orgs, measuring in-game ad performance, or tracking tournament viewership metrics, I turn raw data into a victory.

title: Marketing Analytics In Gaming and Esports
text:
What You‚Äôll Find

Campaign Performance Analysis: Measuring ROI for gaming brands, sponsorships, and influencer collaborations.
Data Visualization: Dashboards tracking Tiwtch viewership, social engagement, and in-game purchase behavior.
Marketing Mix & Attribution: Breaking down which digital platform (Discord, Twitter, TikTok) drive the most conversions for different campaigns.
Customer & Market Insights: Using analytics to better understand our target audience (the gamers) and hwat keeps them playing our game or engaging with our products.

title: In-Game Ad Performance Dashboard
text:
Overview
I built a real-time dashboard tracking player interactions with in-game ads (e.g., banner clicks, rewarded video completions) for a mobile RPG.




Outcomes

Identified a 15% drop-off rate during unskippable ads‚Äîled to A/B testing shorter formats.

Top-performing ad placement: Main menu (pre-lobby) had a 22% higher CTR than post-match screens.





Key Skills Gained

Google Analytics 4 (custom events)

Tableau for visualizing player funnel drop-offs





CTR by Ad Placement

library(ggplot2)

# Simulated ad performance data
ad_data <- data.frame(
  Placement = c("Main Menu", "Post-Match", "Inventory", "Loading Screen"),
  CTR = c(22, 15, 8, 4),
  Drop_Off_Rate = c(15, 28, 42, 50)
)

# Plot
ggplot(ad_data, aes(x = reorder(Placement, -CTR), y = CTR)) +
  geom_col(fill = "#00B0F0") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(CTR, "%")), vjust = -0.5) +
  labs(
    title = "In-Game Ad Click-Through Rates (CTR)",
    subtitle = "Main menu ads perform best, but avoid loading screens",
    x = "Ad Placement",
    y = "CTR (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

title: Hi, I‚Äôm Kairi Meechoovet
text: I‚Äôm a Aspiring Game/Esports Community Manager and Designer. I specialize in transforming complex information into clear, engaging, and actionable insights for Esports and Gaming stuff.

title: Hi, I‚Äôm Kairi Meechoovet
text:
About Me
I hold a Business Administration Marketing Management Degree from California State Polytechnic University, Pomona. From the moment I discovered a niche Disney game called Kingdom Hearts on the PlayStation 2, I knew that I wanted to be a keyblade wielder when I grew up. However, (obviously) that dream became a bit impractical. I figured I was better at wielding the pen and paper, especially after the keyblade I made out of foam boards and a wooden dowel broke mid-battle against the darkness (a.k.a. my stuffed animals). These days, I‚Äôve leveled up with the mouse and keyboard finding new creative aspirations, avenues and ways I can get insomnia. A couple of them being League of Legends and Valorant, graphic design and Esports coordination.

title: Hi, I‚Äôm Kairi Meechoovet
text:
Let‚Äôs Connect
You can email me or connect on LinkedIn.

Welcome to my portfolio.

Marketing Lead

title: Bronco Esports
text:
What is Bronco Esports?
Bronco Esports is a competative and causal gaming club run by students at Cal Poly Pomona. Our goal is to promote Esports on and off campus by holding tournaments, reaching out to other schools‚Äô Esports organizations and encuraging our members to go to large-scale events such as FragFest. Bronco Esports fosters various gaming communities under titles such as League of Legends, Valorant, Teamfight Tactics, CS:GO, Rocket League, and more!

WHAT I‚ÄôVE DONE:

Made eye-catching electronic media. Electronic media are used for online social media posts via Discord and Instagram to effectively promote and market each event.
Coordinated gaming tournaments for League of Legends which included the process of planning the date, times, format, rules, media, prizing, registration, and space of the event.
I moderated the Bronco Esports LoL Discord Server with over 300+ members. This included enforcing basic online rules to create a non-toxic and welcoming yet professional college Esports environment, writing announcements in a clear and concise format to inform members details of upcoming events, and communicating with members/officers to coordinate events appropriately.

title: Bronco Esports
section: League of Legends Collegiate Team Tryouts
text:
League of Legends Collegiate Team Tryouts
I led tryouts for a new League of Legends Collegiate team that would be playing for the Fall and Spring Semesters in tournaments like CLOL and NECC.
WHAT I DID:

Made electronic media that are used for online social media posts via Discord and Instagram to effectively promote and market each event.
Wrote informative and creative copy for our Instagram post and the Bronco Esports LoL Discord server (which can be seen below).
Hosted and coordinated tryouts consisting of 20+ participants to form our Fall 2024-Spring 2025 League of Legends Esports Team.
To ensure a professional and well-organized tryout, I made a Google form asking for the minimum required information from players and a Google Excel sheet where they were sorted into pre-made matches.
Administrated pre-made matches to make sure all participants could play their main and secondary roles.



























View this post on Instagram















































A post shared by Bronco Esports (@cppesports)

title: Bronco Esports
text:
Bronco Esports Fall 2024 FragFest
FragFest is a large-scale LAN event that Bronco Esports club hosts every semester. It features competitive Esports tournament for different game titles!
WHAT I DID:

Made an eye-catching electronic media flyer promoting our League of Legends 2v2 Tournament for Fall 2024 FragFest hosted by Bronco Esports.
Made temporary Stream overlays for the Bronco Esports Fall 2024 FragFest Twitch livestream. They are also served as drafts and experimentation for future Bronco Esports stream layouts.
Concepted and directed the theme for Fall FragFest 2024 by working closely with the Bronco Esports media team as media director.
Wrote informative and creative copy for our Instagram post and the Bronco Esports LoL Discord server related to the League of Legends 2v2 tournament.
Coordinated and co-hosted the tournament consisting of 20+ participants.
To ensure a well organized tournament, I made a google form asking the minimum required information from players and a google excel sheet to showcase player op.ggs for strategic drafting.

title: Fighting Game Community (FGC) Survey
text:
Overview
I hosted a survey measuring metrics that drove attendance to local tournaments from a sample of 500+ members from the FGC community at Cal Poly Pomona Bronco Esports.




Learning Outcomes

Weekends Matter: 68% preferred tournaments to be hosted on Fridays or Saturdays over weekdays.
Stream Quality is Prestigious: For viewers, HD broadcasts were more important that the cash rewards.




Key Skills Gained

Event Planning
Market Research





Preferred Tournament Features

library(ggplot2)

# Simulated survey data
fgc_data <- data.frame(
  Feature = c("Prize Pool", "Stream Quality", "Venue", "Game Variety", "Schedule"),
  Importance = c(68, 92, 85, 78, 89)  # % ranking as "Very Important"
)

# Plot
ggplot(fgc_data, aes(x = reorder(Feature, Importance), y = Importance)) +
  geom_segment(aes(xend = Feature, yend = 0), color = "#E63946") +
  geom_point(size = 5, color = "#E63946") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "FGC Tournament Priorities",
    subtitle = "Stream quality > prize money for viewers",
    x = "",
    y = "% Ranking as 'Very Important'"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

title: Case Study: Esports Social Media Engagement Analysis
text:
Overview
In this project, I worked with a Tier 2 Esports organization and helped them track their engagement metrics from their digital platforms such as Twitch, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok in order to identify what content resonates with their audience. I focused on post-tournament attraction, meme trends, and player spotlight campaigns.




Key Insights

Memes & Highlights = 3x Engagement: Short-form video clips of clutch replays outperformed static posts by 200%.
Peak Posting Times: 7-9 PM EST (post-tournament hours) drove the most interactions.
Hashtag Strategy: #LEAGUEOFLEGENDS and #ESPORTS boosted discoverability by 40%.




Key Skills Gained

Social listening (Brandwatch, Sprout Social)

Twitch stream overlay CTR analysis

Audience Sentiment tracking (positive spikes after tournament wins)





Twitter vs Tik Tok

# Load required package
library(ggplot2)

# Simulated engagement data
social_data <- data.frame(
  Platform = c(rep("Twitter", 5), rep("TikTok", 5)),
  Post_Type = rep(c("Meme", "Highlight", "Poll", "AMA", "Giveaway"), 2),
  Engagement_Rate = c(3.2, 4.1, 1.8, 2.5, 5.0, 8.7, 9.2, 2.1, 4.3, 12.1)
)

# Plot
ggplot(social_data, aes(x = Post_Type, y = Engagement_Rate, fill = Platform)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(
    title = "Esports Content Engagement by Platform",
    subtitle = "TikTok clips outperform Twitter posts by 2-3x",
    x = "Post Type",
    y = "Engagement Rate (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#1DA1F2", "#FF0050"))  # Twitter blue + TikTok red










Hashtag Performance

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.4.3



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(tidyr)

# Simulated hashtag performance data across platforms
hashtag_data <- data.frame(
  Hashtag = rep(c("#LeagueOfLegends", "#Esports", "#Gaming", "#LEC"), 3),
  Platform = rep(c("TikTok", "Twitter", "Instagram"), each = 4),
  Discoverability_Lift = c(
    # TikTok performance
    52, 48, 28, 35,
    # Twitter performance
    40, 38, 15, 22,
    # Instagram performance
    45, 42, 20, 30
  )
)

# 1. Combined Platform Visualization
ggplot(hashtag_data, aes(x = reorder(Hashtag, -Discoverability_Lift), 
                       y = Discoverability_Lift, 
                       fill = Platform)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Discoverability_Lift, "%")), 
            position = position_dodge(width = 0.9),
            vjust = -0.5, size = 3) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FF0050", "#1DA1F2", "#E1306C")) + # Platform colors
  labs(
    title = "Hashtag Performance Across Platforms",
    subtitle = "#LeagueOfLegends dominates on TikTok (52% lift vs 40% on Twitter)",
    x = "",
    y = "Discoverability Lift (%)",
    fill = "Platform"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "top")







# 2. Individual Platform Visualizations (Facets)
ggplot(hashtag_data, aes(x = reorder(Hashtag, -Discoverability_Lift), 
                       y = Discoverability_Lift)) +
  geom_col(fill = "#2196F3", width = 0.7) +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Discoverability_Lift, "%")), 
            vjust = -0.5, size = 3.5) +
  facet_wrap(~Platform, nrow = 1) +
  labs(
    title = "Hashtag Performance by Platform",
    subtitle = "TikTok shows highest potential for discoverability growth",
    x = "",
    y = "Discoverability Lift (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(strip.text = element_text(face = "bold"))







# 3. Platform Comparison Heatmap
ggplot(hashtag_data, aes(x = Platform, y = Hashtag, fill = Discoverability_Lift)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white", size = 0.5) +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Discoverability_Lift, "%")), color = "white", size = 4) +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#3F51B5", high = "#FF4081") +
  labs(
    title = "Hashtag Effectiveness Heatmap",
    x = "",
    y = "",
    fill = "Lift (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 0, hjust = 0.5))

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
‚Ñπ Please use `linewidth` instead.











Key Insights From Data

Platform Differences:

Tik Tok hashtags perform best overall (52% max lift)
Twitter performs the worst which can suggest that our audience isn‚Äôt on Twitter that much
Our Instagram can improve
